results.title: Weeding wars in peaceful places
results.creator_credit: Llywellyn Staiff, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Flora, fauna and bushland is what makes Maroondah and Australia different to anywhere else in the world. The agenda of Llywellyn and her colleagues is to protect what’s left.

results.title: Digital Storytelling workshop : general public (March 2007)
results.creator_credit: Alfred Zerfas, Christine Lamb, Edwin Whiting, Joyce Evans, Llywellyn Staiff, Louise Blake, Lyn McLeavy, Martin Zerfas, Sally McCutcheon, Sonya Waters, Sue Silk, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Eleven stories from members of the general public. Mostly autobiographical, they are stories that concern themselves mostly with the passions of the creator, whether social issues, history, hobbies or family. These passions and interests are what makes the participants who they are.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alfred Zerfas, Christine Lamb, Edwin Whiting, Joyce Evans, Llywellyn Staiff, Louise Blake, Lyn McLeavy, Martin Zerfas, Sally McCutcheon, Sonya Waters, Sue Silk, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Weekend at Bernies (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ted Kotcheff, Victor Drai, Gladden Entertainment and Rank Film Productions
results.brief_description: Larry and Richard have just discovered a fraud and embezzlement scheme that’s costing the insurance company they work for millions. Their Mafia connected boss Bernie is behind the crime and invites them for a weekend so he can rub them out. After some major bungling, it’s Bernie who ends up dead and Larry and Richard have to convince everyone Bernie is alive. As the tagline states, “for a corpse, Bernie sure gets around.” Cast includes Andrew McCarthy, Jonathan Silverman, Catherine Mary Stewart and Terry Kiser.

results.title: I am safe
results.creator_credit: Joyce Evans, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In 2005, the Australian Federal Government introduced new laws to address to potential and perceived threat of terrorism. Dubbed the ‘anti-terrorism’ or sedition law, the outcome of the reforms would enable someone to be detained on suspicion of a terrorist act for up to seven days, with significantly less rights than afforded a suspect of any other criminal act. The laws have given Joyce Evans pause for consideration about whether these measures were really going to make Australia safe in the long run, or leave Australia open to despotic rule in the future.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joyce Evans, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Wedlock: a satirical fantasy
results.creator_credit: Ed Spiegel and Louis Clyde Stoumen
results.brief_description: A fantasy which satirises the obscure symbolism of some “experimental” films. Skilled montage of quite disconnected shots adds up to excitement, and often to irony. However, the theme of disenchantment in marriage is treated only lightly, and is soon lost in a desire to exploit the effects of seeping, oozing liquids, intercut with portraits of problem people.

However, the theme of disenchantment in marriage is treated only lightly, and is soon lost in a desire to exploit the effects of seeping, oozing liquids, intercut with portraits of problem people.

results.title: Turbulence 2 (Revised version commissioned by ACMI)
results.material_description: interactive touch-screen and computer, colour, software, video and monitor
results.brief_description: Turbulence is an interactive museum of un-natural history where a menagerie of synthesised forms, ‘evolved’ within the computer using a process of artificial selection. It is one of the most awarded and recognised works of Australian multimedia art. The work consists of a touch-screen interface, used to access a virtual museum of evolved electronic creatures. Over 3 years in production, Turbulence is a collection of abstract thoughts, simulations, ideas, information and poetry. A multiplex of links into an interactive web of computer synthesised imagery relating to the philosophical impact of evolution on contemporary thought.

results.title: Turandot
results.creator_credit: Brian Large, Giuliano Montaldo, National Video Corporation, Radio Televisione Svizzera Italiana (RTSI) and Radiotelevisione Italiana
results.brief_description: Giacomo Puccini’s opera Turandot, with libretto by Giuseppe Adami and Renato Simoni, tells the legend of the beautiful but icy Princess Turandot, and the three riddles she asked her would-be suitors. Performed at the Arena di Verona in 1983 by the Orchestra, Chorus and Corps de Ballet of the Arena di Verona this lavish production with its epic stage setting and beautiful hues of pastel colors features a wonderful cast with Ghena Dimitrova as Turandot, Nicola Martinucci as Prince Calaf, Cecilia Gasia as Liu, Ivo Vinco as Timur. Produced by Giuliano Montaldo, conducted by Maurizio Arena. Sung in Italian. Includes a guide with English translation.

results.title: Weather: rain
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “For the juniors”.
This video is mostly a visual exploration of rain as it falls on a rain forest. There is a child with yellow rain coat and rain hat walking through the rain and speaking of the rain and how things can be appreciated differently as it falls. The water rushes and runs gathering in streams. The child visits the zoo to watch the animals in the rain who don’t seem as fussed about the rain as humans do, drinking from the sky. The child ends up in the playground enjoying the rain here also.
